experience: You and Arcie both know Scott Kwait, Dona Riles, and 49 others
Arcie can introduce you to 4 people at Avella Specialty Pharmacy
Arcie worked at Avella Specialty Pharmacy
Lead Engineer for Altep's Phoenix engineering team.

•	Led a team that has implemented an Angular re-work of an existing customer-facing site that runs through a .Net WebAPI service layer backed by the Entity Framework and MSSQL. I was the Project Lead and did most of my work on the middle and back end and performed code reviews of the front-end worked on by the junior devs assigned to my project (ASP.NET/C#/T-SQL/Entity/Linq/AngularJS)•	Solely in charge of maintaining and upgrading the internal Admin site that manages most of the customer, device, and sales details for the Inilex customer base (ASP.NET/C#/MVC/T-SQL/Linq/T-SQL)•	Refactored various legacy SSRS reports (T-SQL/MS Report Builder)•	Worked as a Support consultant in that they would bring escalated issues to me that didn’t have a clear owner for the code, and I’d work to either fix the bug myself, or determine who the owner is, if applicable

•	Led a team that created, updated and serviced two .NET-based replacement dashboards to replace existing SSRS report-viewer-based metrics viewers for the Arizona Care Network. (ASP.NET/C#/SQL/jQuery + plug-ins)•	Built a console application that leverages Excel to repair corrupted .xls files used to import in healthcare metrics for various healthcare networks (ASP.NET/MS InterOp)•	Co-wrote documentation that established developer standards for the team, as far as software publication schedules and patterns code repo use (TFS)

• Worked with and maintained existing legacy .NET (1.1 to 3.5) code for critical internal pharmacy applications while integrating new software features as requested by various internal stakeholders (ASP.NET/C#/Linq/JavaScript/SQL)• Built console applications in support of critical internal applications for both reporting and maintenance purposes (ASP.NET/C#/SQL)• Created and maintained executive-level reports and analysis, including automatic email subscriptions to these reports (SSRS/SQL/SharePoint)• Helped conceptualize and partially build a new platform to replace multiple internal applications (ASP.NET/C#/MVC/SQL/jQuery/Durandal/KnockoutJS/Linq/Entity)

I worked with designers stakeholders and project managers to architect and develop web-based and winforms-based solutions to client needs.•	Built a prototype service for an RSS feed creator that allows you to register an application and use the feed as both a log of app issues and errors, as well as possibly to create an automatic updated feed for an app’s users. (ASP.NET/C#)•	Leveraged my RSS feed creator service to create an intuitive UI for creating and editing feeds managed by my service manually. (ASP.NET/C#/XSLT)•	Exposed a service that allows you to register email groups under your application which allows you to send emails to every individual address registered under each group in one send call within your application. Also allows email attachments and leverages SMTP. (ASP.NET/C#)•	Built the back-end and data-centric functionality for the University of Phoenix Virtual Organization (VO) Kelsey Elementary’s virtual library application. Currently in use by all students who access this particular VO in their classes. (VBScript/T-SQL)•	Prototyped Siskel, an idea-sharing and voting application for internal use within Apollo Group and its employees. Siskel in its original form was used in an idea-generation contest during the Spring of 2008 by several groups within Apollo Group that included ACU. Siskel also won my former director a certificate presented during an enrollment counselors’ award ceremony.•	Built Riverpoint Writer (RPW – patent pending), Apollo Group’s APA formatting tool and Word plugin currently in wide use by University of Phoenix’s students. RPW is also being used as a recruitment tool by the University of Phoenix Marketing Department, distributing RPW to potential students. A federal patent application under my name is currently on file for this application, as filed by Apollo Group on my behalf.
